abstract: This captivating literature review explores AI's multifaceted applications, illuminating its potential to streamline healthcare management and surgical

title: Applications of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine
abstract: However, sometimes the notification also increases anxiety levels when patients are unable to regulate their glucose levels.28;) Albeit with limited applications, AI tools are seen in nephrology where they can predict the decline of glomerular filtration rates in patients with polycystic kidney disease,29;) and provide risk alerts for progressive IgA nephropathy.30;) AI tools also have wide-ranging applications in the clinical setting of gastroenterology where the use of convolutional neural networks and other deep learning models can process endoscopy and ultrasound images to locate abnormalities.31;) AI tools can diagnose diseases and predict the outcomes, which helps physicians accelerate the treatment process for diseases such as gastroesophageal reflux disease,32;) atrophic gastritis,33;) gastrointestinal hemorrhage,34;) esophageal cancer,35;) Ulcerative colitis,36;) metastasis in colorectal cancer37;) and epidermoid carcinoma.38;) In 2018, the FDA approved “Embrace” a wearable device that can detect generalized epilepsy seizures and alert physicians and caregivers with the necessary information and patients’ locations.39;) Wearable sensors are also used to assess gait, posture, and tremors in patients with multiple sclerosis, Parkinson’s disease, Parkinsonism, and Huntington’s disease.40;) One FDA-approved AI-based algorithm can diagnose cancer in computational histopathology with great accuracy.

title: AI in Medicine | NEJM
abstract: AI in Medicine explores the history and vast potential of artificial intelligence and machine learning across all areas of health care.
